com.aeonium.javafx.validation.annotations

Annotation Type FXNotNull


  • @Documented
 @Target(value=FIELD)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface FXNotNull
    Marks a selection control, e.g., ChoiceBox, as not allowed to have a null value. This constraint is applicable on all controls that support a value property. Currently that is:
    • ChoiceBox
    • ComboBoxBase and its descendants
    Author:
    Robert Rohm <r.rohm@aeonium-systems.de>

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      java.lang.Class<? extends javafx.scene.control.Control>[] applicableFor
      Currently, this annotation and it's validator may be used with javafx.scene.control.ComboBoxBase and it's descendants, and with javafx.scene.control.ChoiceBox.
      java.lang.String message
      Use this attribute to provide a custom message, or, use a key of your resource bundle, if you initialized the ValidatorService with a resource bundle (see ValidatorService.setBundle(java.util.ResourceBundle).
      java.lang.Class<? extends FXAbstractValidator> validation
      The default validator is NotNullValidator, you should not need to change this.

    • Element Detail

      • validation

        public abstract java.lang.Class<? extends FXAbstractValidator> validation
        The default validator is NotNullValidator, you should not need to change this.
        Returns:
        The validator class.
        Default:
        com.aeonium.javafx.validation.NotNullValidator.class

      • applicableFor

        public abstract java.lang.Class<? extends javafx.scene.control.Control>[] applicableFor
        Currently, this annotation and it's validator may be used with javafx.scene.control.ComboBoxBase and it's descendants, and with javafx.scene.control.ChoiceBox. You should not change this values.
        Returns:
        List of all aplicable Control subtypes
        Default:
        {javafx.scene.control.ChoiceBox.class, javafx.scene.control.ComboBoxBase.class}

      • message

        public abstract java.lang.String message
        Use this attribute to provide a custom message, or, use a key of your resource bundle, if you initialized the ValidatorService with a resource bundle (see ValidatorService.setBundle(java.util.ResourceBundle).
        Returns:
        The default message or a key for the resource bundle.
        Default:
        "This field must not be null!"
